profile_positions.description: The main responsibility is thought leadership in development of modeling methodologies and to participate in thermo-mechanical design of Lumileds products.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist

profile_positions.description: In 2011 Philips Applied Technologies merged partly with Philips Research. I am involved in the pre-development of lighting applications by virtual prototyping. Numerical models (FEA) and dedicated tests are combined to understand reliability physics. This understanding is used to improve designs in an early phase of the design cycle reducing the number of physical prototypes and improving reliability of the final product. I am involved in project management, project execution and competence development. From 2012 onwards I am leader of one of the seven work packages in the EU funded FP7 project Nanotherm (http://project-nanotherm.com/). Within this project I am also project manager for the Philips activities.
profile_positions.title: Technologist

profile_positions.description:
My work focuses on numerical analysis (FEA) of fracture and delamination in semiconductor applications and solder connections in LED systems.
I am also involved in other projects relating to different Philips products such as LCD displays, men's shavers and medical devices.
In small projects I have the role as project leader.
profile_positions.title: R&D Technologist

profile_positions.description: Worked at Philips Applied Technologies as hired employee. See Philips Applied Technologies' description for more details.
profile_positions.title: R&D Technologist

profile_positions.description: Writing of paper for Nonlinear Dynamics and exploring measurement set-ups to investigate dynamic stability of shell structures.
